dialogues.text: Ed sits opposite a LOAN OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie is called "Bride Of The Atom"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed continues, pitching to three DENTISTS in white coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It will star Bela Lugosi.  Each of you would put up $20,000...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed stands at a busy intersection.  He YELLS into a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right.  The Bela Lugosi. He's still alive. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Is he available Friday night? Gee, I suppose so... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're backstage at a '5Os variety show.  It's exciting li Showgirls, techies, and cast members dart about in a stat hyped-up tumult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela and Ed sit in his dressing room, running lines.  Bel in his Count outfit: Cape, jet black hair, red lips, etc. both read off SCRIPTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Greetings.  I am the Count."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure." Audience laughs.  Applause.  "Say, that's a funny place to sleep."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It is my home."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, tract housing, huh?"  Laugh. "You need a new real estate agent."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Beg to differ.  This casket incarpratates, er, inporporates --" Ed interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Bela, that's "incorporates."  Look, just say "This casket has..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach!  How do they expect a Hungarian to pronounce this dialogue?  This live television is madness! An ASSISTANT knocks and sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes, Mr. Lugosi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Bela stand in the wings.  Onstage is the SHOW HOST cheesy comedian.  He is doing a routine with Criswell, th famed psychic who opened this movie.  Criswell wears a tu a turban and is acting mysterious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what's gonna happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1960, the automobile will have retractable wings, so it can fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a heck of a way to beat traffic. Audience LAUGHS.  Criswell rubs his temples enigmatically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By 1970, Man will have colonized Mars.  Millions of people will live there. Ed is mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  Ain't that something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out in the audience.  The curtain rises on a SPOOKY Shadows, cobwebs, and a coffin in the center.  The Host w onstage, to huge APPLAUSE.  He's playing his "Slick" char a befuddled moron in a funny hat.  The Host shines a flas around, and then the coffin opens.  Bela sits up.  There' APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings.  I am the Count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure. The audience LAUGHS.  Then APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, that's a funny place to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, tract housing, huh? (he starts AD-LIBBING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I shouldn't complain about my duplex in Burbank.  What a dump. Some places have a Murphy bed, this place has a Murphy shower.  I still don't know where to hang the towels! The audience HOWLS with laughter.  Bela is totally lost. seems incredibly confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, beg to differ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Beg to differ?!"  Hey, I'm talkin' about my duplex in Burbank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified, groping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Greetings.  I am the Count...

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Ed covers his face in embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Host angrily storms past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we should've gotten Karloff. He exits.  A door opens, and Ed and Bela quietly step out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, don't worry.  You're better than all this crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said I could ad-lib...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it.  We'll make our new movie, and you'll be a star again. They shuffle away... until Criswell and his snazzy ENTOUR burst around a corner.  Even in person, Criswell is ether and quite self-important.  He is delighted to see Bela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lugosi!  It is an unparalleled privilege to meet you.  Allow me to introduce myself... I am CRISWELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (morose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, cheer up!   Don't lose heart over what happened tonight. (he points at his temple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predict that your next project will be an outstanding success!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who may you be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward Wood, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  The director of "Glen Or Glenda."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-how'd you know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Criswell.  I know all. Criswell winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latin horns blast onstage of this hopping '5Os nightclub. Cigarette girls roam about.  Seated at a front table is E Bela, and Criswell's group.  Everyone's plastered and lau Criswell shouts above the din at a WAITER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me two more Beefeater martinis. Eddie will have another whiskey, Dagmar's a Rum-and-coke, Moustapha and King are chablis -- hey Bela, would you like a wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I never drink -- wine. The whole table CRACKS UP.  Bela cheers up.  Ed turns to Criswell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Cris, how'd you know we'd be living on Mars by 1970?  How'd you know it wouldn't be 1975, or even

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made it up.  It's horseshit! Ed's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a psychic. People believe my folderol because I wear a turban and a black tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, we're in show biz!  It's all about razzle-dazzle.  Appearances. If you dress nice and talk well, people will swallow anything. Criswell smiles knowingly.  Ed nods at this profound wisd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outside the legendary hat-shaped restaurant.  A lar Eldorado pulls up, and a CONSERVATIVE MAN and his PLUMP W step out and approach the DOORMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  We're here for the Wood party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that would be in the Venetian Room, sir. The couple raise their eyebrows.  They're impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large banner says "BRIDE OF THE ATOM - NEXT YEAR'S SMAS

dialogues.speaker: HIT
dialogues.text: In a private back room, Ed is throwing a LAVISH BACKERS P All his riff-raff friends are dressed in tuxedos and gown strutting about with flutes of champagne like they're ext in "The Great Gatsby." Bewildered POTENTIAL BACKERS wander around.  Ed shmoozes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have the most terrifying monster ever seen on film!  A ghastly creature created from an atomic mutation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like scary movies.  I go more for ones with love stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without dropping a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's what this movie is... a heartbreaking romance!  It's about a young reporter, Janet Lawton, in love with a young cop, Dick Craig.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Conrad and Paul sit in a corner.  Conrad has a shoe off a scratching his foot.  Ed alarmedly runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These shoes are itchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't sit!  You gotta walk around, with good posture.  You want these people to think we have class. Otherwise they'll never invest in our movie.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARTY
dialogues.text: Two AMAZED BACKERS have their hands around Tor's giant ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, get a load of this guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud of his size)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biceps 22! Chest 62! Stomach 54!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew!  You're quite a specimen. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna be in the picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I play Lobo!

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: An excited HICK BACKER shakes Bela's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lugosi, I can't believe I'm meeting you in person.  This is one of the most exciting moments of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Johnson!  I manufacture toothpaste tubes.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARTY
dialogues.text: Criswell struts in the b.g., talking to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predict "Bride Of The Atom" will be the biggest moneymaker of all time! In the f.g., Ed introduces Dolores to a SOUTHERN BACKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is lovely starlet Dolores Fuller, who will play Janet Lawton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much will this picture cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a normal studio it would be half-a-million, with all their wasteful overhead and fancy offices. But because we're more efficient, we can bring it in for seventy grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Well I'll consider it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and his buddies wave goodbye to the departing backers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye!  Goodbye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faking a big smile, but SOTTO VOCE to Bela)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't make a dime.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: A VALET hands the car keys to the Conservative Backer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's twenty-five cents, sir. The man glances at his Wife. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave all my money to the babysitter. The man grimaces.  He checks his pockets, pulls out a han of PENNIES, and counts them out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed sits in a chaise lounge by the pool, studying papers a drinking shots of whiskey.  He's in a woman's pantsuit an fuzzy slippers.  Dolores marches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, the landlord called again.  He wants his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him "Bride" is in pre- production.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, the landlord doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem!  Nobody cares about my movie!  I'm tryin' so hard, I don't know what else to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get angry at me.  Maybe you just need a day job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, don't you understand?  I'm a director now!  I made "Glen Or Glenda."  Directing is my day job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is, ever since "Glen Or Glenda," all you do is booze it up and wear my clothes! Suddenly Paul hesitantly steps through the back gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yoo-hoo.  Excuse me!  Sorry to interrupt, but I got some big news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dour)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well my cousin Fred met this dame from back East.  She's from "old money," and he thinks she's loaded. And here's the kicker: She's very interested in the picture business!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He slowly smiles. It's like sun breaking through rain clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a fancy outdoor brunch.  Ed is shaking hands wit pretty LORETTA KING, 25, a pale brunette in a classy dres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you.  I'm Loretta King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you just moved here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Hollywood is oh so exciting. A WAITER walks over, with a water pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water, Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly freaking out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No water!  NO LIQUIDS!  I'm terribly allergic to them! The waiter is bewildered.  He hurries away.  Ed leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my associate Mr. Marco tells me you may be interested in investing in a motion picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps a small amount of money. (she smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do one of your motion pictures cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this one, we need $60,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all??  That seems very reasonable for an entire picture. Ed perks up.  She's a live one! Ed pulls a script from his briefcase and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like to look at the photoplay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, this is very interesting. (she skims the pages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say... do you think it would be possible for me to maybe play one of these parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very enthused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, of course!!  There's a couple characters you'd be perfect for: The secretary at the newspaper office, or the file clerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Those sound kind of small. (stopping at a page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here's one that looks good: Janet Lawton.  I'd sure like to play her. Ed blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J-Janet Lawton???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Janet Layton is clearly the part to play.  She's got some real meaty scenes!  Can't you just see me in that part??

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: He is aghast.  What a stomach-churning decision.  He star Loretta, then slowly croaks a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR dishes being violently thrown.  Dolores SCREAMS i DOLORES (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard!  You two-timing, dress-wearing son-of-a-BITCH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores is crying and screaming angrily.  Ed ducks the ob she hurls at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the only way I could get the movie made!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think's been paying the rent?!  Who helped type your script, and did all your grunt work?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!  What did you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you to say, "No!  I wrote the part for my girlfriend Dolores."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's plenty of other parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary.  Or the file clerk. Dolores is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: YOU ASSHOLE
dialogues.text: She hurls a pot at Ed.  WHACK!  It slams him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sets are being erected for "Bride Of The Atom"!  The hurries about the small stage, as Ed energetically superv He has a large band-aid on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be Bela's laboratory, so it should be real impressive! Like one of those mad scientist movies.  I want beakers, and test tubes, and one of those electrical things that buzzes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a Tesla coil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so. Tor lumbers over, in his ripped Lobo outfit.  His face ha gashed-up scars.  Tor holds the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edvard!   I haf question 'bout script. My vife Greta, she read.  And she no like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Was the third act too intense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be polite)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She tink Lobo is waste of my time.  Lobo don't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tor, it's a starring part! You're second billed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, he talk.  Loretta, she talk. But Tor, he no talk. Ed thinks.  He quickly puts a spin on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor, dialogue is overrated.  You look at the classic film actors, who are they?  Fairbanks.  Chaplin.  They didn't talk!  They did it all with their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still bothered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Greta say -- Loretta walks over, holding two dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, which dress do you like better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (he yells o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bill, which dress is better for you, the green or the red one? Cameraman Bill is standing at the camera.  He squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is the red one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I can't see the difference. I'm color-blind. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like the dark gray one.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The crew is shooting on a spooky castle foyer set.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Bela enters, wearing a lab coat costume.  As he slowly cr the old man rubs his hands fiendishly.  Ed YELLS live dir through a megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're Dr. Eric Vornoff. You're upset. You've worked so hard on this experisent, and you don't want to see it fail. (Bela stops, to "emote")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not that upset.  You want to keep moving.  You wanna cross the room. (Bela exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, CUT!  BEAUTIFUL!  PRINT IT! Ed claps his hands triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's go immediately to Scene 52.  Tor, are you in place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, CUE RAINSTORM! Behind the window, Conrad pours a watering can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And roll camera!  ACTION! Tor enters, but can barely squeeze his bulk through the d Finally he enters.  Ed YELLS through the segaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're Lobo.  You're upset. You've worked so hard helping Dr. Vornoff on this experiment, and you don't want to see it fail. (Tor stops, to "emote")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not that upset.  You want to keep moving.  You wanna cross the room. (Tor exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, CUT!  PERFECT!  PRINT IT!

dialogues.speaker: OFF STAGE
dialogues.text: Bela talks to Tor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Universal, they shot two scenes a day.  Eddie can knock off twenty or thirty!  He's incredible.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SET
dialogues.text: Cameraman Bill leans in to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Ed, shouldn't we do another take? Big Baldy kinda got stuck in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine.  It's real!  In actuality, Lobo would struggle with that problem every day.

dialogues.speaker: LABORATORY SET
dialogues.text: They are back on the completed lab set.  Beyond the bunse burners and beakers is a kitchenette in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, this lab looks great.  Except why is there a stove and refrigerator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't afford any more props. If it seems weird, maybe you can add a scene where they eat dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it'll work.  Where's Bela? Bela is asleep on a couch.  Ed nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he groggily wakes up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmph?  Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shooting "Bride Of The Atom." Scene 85. Bela nods.  He stands up, then grimaces in pain.  So he p two BRIGHT LITTLE PILLS from his pocket and swallows them Ed walks Bela onto the lab set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be sitting on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he glares at the sparking Tesla coils)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting near that goddamn thing.  One of those burned me on "The Return Of Chandu."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Then you'll be sitting on the left. Ed turns to Tor and Loretta.  She wears a wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the scene.  Loretta, you're in a trance.  You glide in and get on the operating table.  Now Tor, you're supposed to tie her down.  But you have an angora fetish... and when you rub that swatch of angora, it makes you refuse so Bela has to discipline you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey-dokey.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING
dialogues.text: The scene begins.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: BELA (as VORNOFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now we are ready for the girl." Bela does his patented hypnotic arm wave.  He actually ha powerful intensity.  Loretta staggers in, eyes glazed.  L zombie, she climbs onto the operating table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear, you are a woman of super strength and beauty.  A lovely vision of exquisitely beauty -- shit!" (he breaks character)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  Eddie, I'm sorry I can't remember all this.  I'm an old man. It's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, Bela.  We're still rolling.  Just say "Dear, you're lovely."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he snaps back into character)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear, you're lovely." (he turns to Tor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Strap her to the table." Tor starts to tie Loretta down, then gets distracted by a of angora hooked to his waist.  He rubs it lovingly, calm then suddenly refuses. Bela is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Do as I command you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela pulls out an oversized BULLWHIP and starts WHIPPING Tor screams in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'll teach you to disobey me!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela chases Tor around the set, WHIPPING him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, CUT!!!  Impeccable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dances about happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love being movie star!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor jubilantly hugs Loretta.  She grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.  Not so hard, Tor.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: A SURLY STAGE MANAGER strides over to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wood. Your check bounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll get you the money later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I need it NOW. Ed nods grimly.  He grabs Loretta and takes her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to bother you while we're shooting, but the guy who owns the stage needs his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then you should pay him, shouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Exactly! There's a pause.  They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda need it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at me like that for?  I already gave you my three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well I need the other sixty-thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other sixty-thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other sixty-thousand you said you'd give me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You misunderstood.  I gave you everything I have in the world: Three-hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He looks like he s going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large stage door SLAMS shut. Ed's disoriented cast and crew stand in the street.  Bela and Loretta are still in costume. Ed looks totally dazed.  He blinks in the bright sunlight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back at the Brown Derby, for another backers party. same banner is hanging: "BRIDE OF THE ATOM -- NEXT YEAR'S

dialogues.speaker: HIT
dialogues.text: The whole crowd is there, dressed up.  Bela sits in the c knocking back a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go again. Paul whispers to Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is Dolores coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very catty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine why.  I wouldn't put up with a boyfriend who sold me out for three-hundred dollars...!

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: Ed stands with a circle of POTENTIAL BACKERS.  He has an of desperation we've never seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lemme tell you, you can't lose. It's scary!  And if you don't like that, it's romantic!  Bela Lugosi portrays Dr. Vornoff, and lovely ingenue Loretta King is reporter Janet Lawton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm.  Lugosi looks pretty old. (he squints across the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which role is Vampira playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampira...? (bewildered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I see her standing over there. The guy points.  Ed turns and looks and Vampira is standi in the next room.  She's at a different party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... she's playing -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you excuse me one moment?? Ed dashes from the room.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT ROOM OVER
dialogues.text: Vampira is drinking with a bunch of artsy-fartsy types. in street clothes, but clearly recognizable.  Ed runs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss Vampira?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweaty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me, but my name is Ed Wood.  I'm a film producer.  I'm currently in production on a science-fiction piece, with Bela Lugosi and Swedish wrestler Tor Johnson.  And I saw you here, and I thought: Kismet! Vampira stares, totally uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  Do you want my autograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think my film is perfect for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to show it on my TV program?  Well I got nothing to do with that.  You should call up the station manager at Channel Seven --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unyielding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I don't want you to show the movie, I want you to be in it!  See, maybe I should explain: We started shooting, but then after three days we got shut down.  So we're having a backers party, to raise some more money.  Perhaps you'd like to come next door and meet some of the backers...? Vampire glances at her friends.  They uncomfortably turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, look, I'm with some friends, and we're about to eat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!  It'll only take a minute. You can have some hors d'oeuvres, and meet my backers!  There's a really nice dentist from Oxnard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look buddy, I'm a big star.  I've got real offers from real studios.  I don't need to blow some dentist for a part.  So forget it!

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE PARTY
dialogues.text: The backers glance into the next room.  Ed is in front of Vampira, begging on his hands and knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another backer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a bad feeling about this. Let's get out of here. The backers pick up their coats.  Through the doorway, Ed this.  He jumps up and frantically runs back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you guys going?!  You can't leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. Wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go!  You haven't seen the storyboards! The backers run out of the room. They're gone. Ed shouts after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!  SCREW YOU!  If you don't have the balls to roll the dice, then I don't want your stinking money!! No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Dolores are being evicted.  Their belongings are scattered in front.  They bitterly carry furniture out of house.  Ed stumbles and slurs his speech.  He is drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn landlord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you this was gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you'd come to the backers party, I would've gotten the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's moronic.  Why would a bit player impress a backer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he starts yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, how many times can I say I'm sorry?  I blew it!  I thought she was rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good reason to dump your girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't dump you!  Get it through your skull -- I just recast the part! Ed drops the furniture.  He flops onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fuckin' mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So WHAT??  Look, we gotta figure out where we're gonna stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to my mother's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she have room for me? Dolores shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should stay with one of your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Bela stroll through a parking lot.  Ed is sobered remorseful.  Bela wears a beret and smokes a huge cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, I don't know what I'm doin' anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop worrying.  This is going to raise your spirits. They reach the strange entrance to an avant-garde, Easter based quasi-religious temple.  Bela puts out his cigar, a they enter the oversized doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sphinxes and Bodhisatvas peer down from the marble walls. service is in progress.  A wiry, enigmatic LECTURER speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou eternal sun, who has covered the consciousness with thy golden disc, do thou remove the veil so that I may see the truth within? Bela leads Ed to a seat, stepping past men in fezzes and elderly women in fur coats.  As the lecture continues, Ed WHISPERS in bafflement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Philosophical Research Society.  A refuge for free thinkers. I've been coming here for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for the truth which is within thee is within me.  And I am Truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people in this country, they know nothing, about Eastern mysticism. They are afraid of it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am open-minded.  It gives me hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the wisdom to govern and the divine right to inherit the earth in good condition.  We have the power to build worlds. Ed leans in to Bela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I wrong to cast Loretta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad decisions are easy to live with. Forget.  Just keep looking forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But was it a bad decision?  At the time, I thought her money would save the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, you screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The lecture is over.  The speaker shakes hands with peopl Bela leads Ed along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In life, the decisions that haunt you are the ones where you just don't know... where right or wrong will never be answered. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago, the Hungarians contacted me.  The government wanted me to come home, to be Minister of Culture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a very impressive offer. Fancy offices, a big home... I'd be  treated like a king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why didn't you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if it was a trick. They might arrest me and throw me in a gulag. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Hungary's most famous emigrant. they'd use me as a lesson to anyone who tries to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.  So instead, I stayed here, waiting for my comeback.  Always hoping... the next film, the next film... that would be the one. They reach the exit.  Ed stops in the huge doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your next film.  That will be the one. Bela smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a noisy meat-packing plant.  WORKERS in blood-st aprons slam cleavers into hunks of beef. Ed walks down an aisle with DONALD E. McCOY, a wealthy Te meat man.  Old Man McCoy is a tough-talking, tobacco-chew straight shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then Dr. Vornoff falls in the pit, and his own octopus attacks and eats him!  The End. OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew!  That's quite a story.  So you made the movie, and now you want to make it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently correcting him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We shot ten minutes of the movie, and now we're looking for completion funds. OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you're too vague.  I come from the world of business.  I need to know what I get for my investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movies are very popular.  You could make a lot of money. OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but most of 'em flop, don't they?  What am I tangibly guaranteed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you get "Executive Producer" credit. OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't mean diddley. (he suddenly SHOUTS angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY BOB!  You're cutting 'em TOO LEAN. McCoy grabs a CLEAVER from a worker and slams it into a c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCoy, how can I make you happy? OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to the chase, heh?  That's good! That's very good. McCoy SPITS his tobacco. OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, two things.  Number one: I want the movie to end with a big explosion.  Sky full of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the story ends with Dr. Vornoff falling in the pit -- OLD MAN McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.  And number two: I've got a son.  He's a little slow -- but a good boy.  And something tells me he'd make a hell of a leading man... Under Ed's cheery frozen smile, his face clearly falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a ROWDY wrestling match.  Tor Johnson is in the of a screaming, four-man tag-team event.  Tor THROWS his opponent to the ground; then tags with his partner and go the corner. Suddenly a WRESTLING COACH runs up, dragging a telephone very long cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor, you got a phone call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh?  NOW?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said it was an emergency! He hands sweaty Tor the phone.  Tor speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor, this is Ed!  Glad I could find you!  I got the money, and we resume shooting tomorrow morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm in Utah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll have to drive all night! I'm counting on you, big guy. Breakfast is at seven. CLICK.  Ed hangs up.  Tor is flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bride Of The Atom" is back in production!  Ed's stock co is reunited.  People drink coffee and gossip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is unbelievable!  I woulda bet a million bucks that Ed wouldn't finish this picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't finished yet.  Anything could happen. The stage door opens and standing there, in silhouette, i Dolores.  Everybody quiets.  People glance nervously at Loretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.  Stay out of scratching distance.

dialogues.speaker: AT DOLORES
dialogues.text: Ed runs over.  Dolores is beautifully made-up, and wearin furry angora sweater.  Ed speaks, awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you made it! I wasn't sure you got my message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm here.  Today is the file clerk's big scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the usual gang of misfits and dope addicts are here. (she looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, who's the lug? In a corner, standing by himself, is dumb TONY McCOY, Old McCoy's worthless son.  He's a good-looking, moody hunk. is practicing his lines from a script, but he's terribly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now Janet, I want you straying away -- oops -- staying away from the old Willows Place." Ed shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Tony McCoy.  He's playing Lieutenant Dick Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?  How much money did he put up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his dad gave me fifty grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snide)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood Productions.  The mark of quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the movie's getting made. That's the main thing. Dolores shakes her head contemptuously.  Then she strides Ed stands alone, feeling bad.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: The set is a one-wall "office hallway": A doorway and a w cooler.  Loretta sits in a make-up chair, as Harry works her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Harry -- long time no see. Harry turns, surprised.  Dolores stands behind him.  Ther thick tension.  He smiles anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dolores...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're Dolores?!  I've heard so much about you!  I'm Loretta King. (she chipperly jumps up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitchy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly -- let Harry finish. You still need more work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm done.  All I needed was a touch-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm, that mole still shows. Loretta frowns.  Ed quickly steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies!  You both look fine.  Why don't we talk about the scene? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Janet Lawton has discovered that Dr. Vornoff bought the old Willows estate.  So now she wants to prove that all the monster stories are true. Dolores nods sourly.  She s in a trouble-making mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, what's my motivation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Er... well you're the file clerk.  You're hurrying into the next room, when you bump into Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's our relationship?  Are we good friends, or is she just a casual acquaintance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, I got five days to shoot this movie.  Quit kidding around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching DAILIES.  Projected ON SCREEN, a camera assistant claps the slate.  We hear Ed yell: "Action!" Loretta hurries down the hallway.  Dolores sees her run p and shouts out. DOLORES (as File Clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Janet, the boss has been looking for you." LORETTA (as Janet Lawton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Thanks." Loretta runs out.  Dolores just stands there.  We HEAR Ed

dialogues.speaker: "CUT
dialogues.text: Dolores turns deadpan to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it was. The FILM runs out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The screening room lights come up on the crew.  Ed sits i gloomy haze. Suddenly, there's loud CLAPPING from the back of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo!  Bravo!  Magnifico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, you made it.  Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.  I'm always happy to assist in a little larceny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: g pink Cadillac convertible races down the Ed and Criswell are in front, and Tor, Conrad and Paul to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head is cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much this car cost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE DOLLAR!  Miss Mae West herself sold it to me.  She said, Cris, you belong in a pink Cadillac! Criswell turns to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incidentally, you promise you're not going to scratch my car...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, the octopus is made of rubber.  This is a piece o' cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five men climb over a fence.  They're breaking into Republic Studios.  Paul is panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, you said you were getting permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I couldn't reach the guy... he was in meetings all day.  But this'll be great, I promise! Ed smiles at Conrad.  Conrad shrugs.  Tor struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no good at climbink. Tor gives up, and simply BASHES through the locked gate. Everyone is amazed.  Tor laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good at bashink!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, keep it down.  My publicist will throttle me if we get caught. They all sneak across the shadowy lot.  Remnants of old s sets tower over them.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE A SOUNDSTAGE
dialogues.text: They reach a stage door. Ed tries it -- but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  I thought they kept this open. A pause.  Everyone looks at Tor.  He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobo will fix! Tor grabs the heavy door and easily SNAPS the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is the mythic eclectic prop room.  Guillotines rocketships, a stuffed vulture... strange mysterious prop untold movies loom everywhere in the darkness. It's a place of wonderment and fear. The men stare in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place gives se the creeps. Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast.  First we have to get it down. Ed gestures above.  Everyone glances straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant OCTOPUS is lashed to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Conrad and Criswell are way up on the catwalk, holding on dangling Paul by his belt.  Paul leans way out, reaching the octopus.  He shouts nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure this is gonna work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing straight below is Tor.  The Swede has his arms outstretched, waiting. Ed supervises a good distance away.  He motions to Paul. Paul gulps, then unties the octopus. It drops incredibly fast.  The thing must weigh half a to Tor's eyes widen. And the octopus smashes straight on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: Tor is gone from sight.  One of the eight tentacles snaps

dialogues.speaker: UP IN THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Criswell moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  We killed him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Ed runs to the octopus and looks for Tor underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor!  Are you okay?! A beat.  And then the octopus flips over.  Tor sits up, battered but smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedder than wrestlink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five men hurry across the lot, carrying the hubongous octopus on their shoulders. Suddenly, a FLASHLIGHT shines on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What are you doing?! The men jump with fear.  They break into a fast waddling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God Tor broke the fence. The team runs through the busted gate and escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac SCREECHES away.  The octopus flops on top of five men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie crew is setting up for a big night shoot.  Ligh generators are sprawled across this isolated area. Tony McCoy perches goofily on his own personalized chair. runs lines by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now Janet, I want you staying away from the old Willows Place." The octopus lays in a dried-up riverbed.  There's only ab inch of water.  Ed yells at Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand!  The octopus is supposed to live in a lake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kind of a stream--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!  It has to be UNDERWATER! Ed storms away.  Conrad scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: IN A DUSTY PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Bela sits inertly in the back of an open car.  He weakly over Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I'm so tired... I don't know if I can handle a night shoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense!  You look great -- (suddenly he catches himself; he speaks more sincerely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, uh, why don't you lie down and take a little nap?  We'll film around you for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy... Ed smiles warmly, then walks off. Bela stares after him, then absent-mindedly searches thro his pockets.  Finally, he finds what he's looking for -- rubber tube.  Bela looks to make sure no one's around, th ties the tube around his upper arm...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SET
dialogues.text: Crew members have dammed up the end of the river, and Bun fills it with a hose.  There is now a foot of water. Ed stands at the shore, admiring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  This is looking good! (he turns to Paul)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, where's the octopus motor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What octopus motor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, to make the legs move --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't blame me!  You didn't say anything about no motor when I was up on that ceiling! Bela stumbles up, with a dazed smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's shoot this fucker!  Where do I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fighting with the octopus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out there?! (he points at the water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the stream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll look a lot better.  We have to match the stock footage of the octopus underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake. Bela rolls up his pants and wades out, into the water.  H screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, it's cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you're in it, it warms up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!  You come out here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, toss me that J.D. A crew member throws Bela a bottle of Jack Daniels. Bela pops the cap and chugs half the bottle in one swig. licks his lips, then climbs onto the octopus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  How do we turn this thing on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, somebody misplaced the motor. So when you wrestle the octopus, shake the legs a bit, to make it look like it's killing you. Bela stares, deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know I turned down "Frankenstein"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I did "Dracula," the studio offered me "Frankenstein"!  But I turned it down, the part wasn't sexy enough.  It was too degrading for a big star like me. The crew glances at Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, I've got twenty-five scenes to shoot tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me slow you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!  Let's put it on film.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA
dialogues.text: Bela takes another swig of J.D., then throws it off-camer

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Bela starts flailing around the octopus legs and SCREAMIN horror.  This image is truly ridiculous.      Ed is pleased.                               Some crew members nod: Pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CUT!                                     Everybody cheers. Then suddenly the dam walls BURST. WHOOSH!  The water rushes from the lake and floods the pa below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crew members straggle in for the final shoot.  Everybody bleary-eyed from last night.  Ed stands cheerily at the entrance, greeting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!  Just one more day!  Just have some coffee, you'll feel better! Tony staggers up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood, I only got one hour of sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well I got no sleep, and I feel great! Ed sees Bela slowly shuffling along. Ed runs over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela.  I just wanna thank you again for last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, Eddie.  All in the line of duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Seriously.  I want you to know how much I appreciate what you've done for me.  A great man like you shouldn't have to run around in freezing water at four in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there aren't too many other fellas I'd do it for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles, then pulls out a script page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote something special for you. I got to thinking about all the sacrifices you've made... and so I wrote you a new final speech. Ed hands him the paper.  Bela starts reading it, as Ed wa anxiously.  Bela is very touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, this is quite a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's a lot to give you at the last second. Bela looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These lines -- I'll have no problem remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are shooting.  Ed watches off-camera, as Bela acts a somber scene with an actor playing PROFESSOR STROWSKI, a threatening European.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Our government wants you to return... to continue your experiments there.  Where you can have everything at your disposal." BELA (as VORNOFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My dear Professor Strowski, twenty years ago I was banned from my home land.  I was classed as a madman -- a charlatan -- outlawed in the world of science which previously honored me as a genius!" (he gets very subdued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now here in this forsaken jungle hell, I have proven that I am alright."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yes, the authorities have learned how correct your findings were.  So I am here -- sent to bring you home."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impassioned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Home.  I have no home.  Hunted... despised... living like an animal -- the jungle is my home!  But I will show the world that I can be its master.  I shall perfect my own race of people -- a race of atomic supermen that will conquer the world!" It's an incredible performance of crowning tragedy.  Bela totally drained.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: He is very moved.  He whispers, barely audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut.  It's a wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrap party is being thrown in the meat packing plant. People laugh and shout and carry on.  Tor pours booze in punch.  R&B MUSIC plays.  Old Man McCoy dances with L Bunny dances with a young stud.  Dolores stands by hersel Bela and Criswell are giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you sleep in coffins?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  There is nothing more comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this!  I sleep in coffins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!  My father ran a mortuary -- it's an old habit! They CLINK beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Vampira and two GIRL FRIENDS walk up.  They peer tin sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "McCoy Meat Packing"?  Are you sure there's a party here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding an INVITATION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got this invitation.  It's a "Bride Of The Atom" party, whatever that means. They open the large steel door, and INSIDE is the wild ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Paul and Conrad chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Glen Or Glenda," now that was a hell of a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this new one's gonna be a hundred times better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that possible? Dolores overhears this.  She stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TURNTABLE
dialogues.text: Someone changes the record.  Brassy STRIPPER MUSIC begins A door opens, and Ed struts out, in full gaudy drag. Everybody turns.  They start WHISTLING and HOLLARING. Ed grins, and starts into a wacky bump-and-grind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, baby, go! Bunny runs up and sticks a dollar bill between Ed's fake People LAUGH hysterically. Dolores is appalled. Ed shimmies to the music, blowing kisses all around.  He Vampira and waves. Vampira's jaw drops in recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.  It's him! Ed sashays up to Bela and dances a few steps with him.  T music is building to a climax.  Ed hurries off to center -- and as the MUSIC ENDS, he does a final swing of his hi then suddenly yanks out his teeth! This brings down the house.  Everyone STAMPS their feet a CLAPS crazily.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Everyone, except Dolores.  Suddenly, she explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people are INSANE!  Take a look around -- you're all FREAKS! The room quiets.  Dolores has snapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your lives making SHIT!  Nobody cares!  These movies are TERRIBLE! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it any longer! The group is shocked.  Nobody speaks. Dolores runs out of the party. Ed just stands, dumbstruck.  Then he chases after her, in high heels and dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores runs across the parking lot, in tears.  Ed catche with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, it's over.  I need a normal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really mean those things you said..? Dolores stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of living on the fringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you used to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed... I just stuck it out so you could finish your movie. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that it's done, so am I. She turns and walks away.  Ed is crushed.  He stands motionless, in his dress, in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's new home is a single apartment, still filled with mo boxes.  Half-eaten plates of food are scattered about.  E asleep in bed, unshaven, in the middle of the day. The phone RINGS.  Ed awakens and woozily answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... TOR (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, dit I wake you?  It's two in avternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was just doin' a little work... TOR (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullchit!  You been like dis too many days.  I want to cheer you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed drives his Nash though a tract Valley neighborhood and reaches Tor's little house.  Ed gets out, still looking g He walks up the tulip-lined path and rings the DOORBELL. Clanging SWEDISH CHIMES bong inside. The door flies open, and Tor appears, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edvard, you come! Tor gives Ed a back-breaking hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed steps in.  The house is filled with cuckoo clocks and Swedish knick-knacks.  Tor gestures proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so happy you visit.  Meet my family!  Greta, Karl, and Connie! THREE COLOSSAL PEOPLE lumber out.  Tor has the largest fa we've ever seen.  Not fat -- but big-boned.  GRETA is Tor gigantic Swedish wife, and KARL and CONNIE are their two elephantine children.  They ADLIB greetings: "Hallo!" "Welcome!" "Is a pleasure!" Ed cannot believe what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone noisily eats dinner.  The table looks like a Smorgasbord.  Entire hams, turkeys, a full case of beer, incredible quantities are being shoveled in.  Tor empties beer in one gulp, then opens another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass the meatballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This strudel is delicious, Mama. Ed is stupefied.  He picks at a little dainty serving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You're not eatink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't have much of an appetite lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food will make you feel bedder. Look at me -- I'm da happiest guy I know! All the Johnsons CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be happy too, if I had such a great family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  You just haven't met right woman yet. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oopsy.  That cabbage goes right through me. Tor stands and hurries from the room.  Ed awkwardly makes conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta, your husband is a terrific actor.  You should come down and visit the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's really no problem at all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not approve of what you do with my husband Tor.  He is not a monster. These horror pictures are humiliating. Ed has no response.  Suddenly -- CRASH!  There's a loud o SLAM, falling porcelain, then Tor SHOUTS FURIOUSLY in Swe

dialogues.speaker: OUCH
dialogues.text: Earl and Connie begin giggling. Ed is totally baffled. Tor runs out, angrily holding a BROKEN TOILET SEAT.  It i split in two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it happened again! Ed is boggle-eyed.  This house is sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor, I should be getting home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense!  You must try our hot glug.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: It's very late.  Tor and Ed sit in the living room, drink from a steaming pot of hot stilled wine.  They are smashe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend, you tink Greta is first woman I ever see?  No!  Many duds, before I find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought me and Dolores had something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget her!  Move on.  A good lookink boy like you as you can have any girl you wish. Tor finishes his glug, and then his eyes roll back into h head, and he falls off the couch.  He starts SNORING. Ed stares at Tor, then gets up.  Ed turns off the lights goes home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed smokes a cigarette and watches TV.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: Vampira is doing her shtick. VAMPIRA (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo!  That was so scary, it gave me goosebumps. (someone QUACKS os.; she pretends to be angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dummy!  I didn't say "goose," I said "goosebumps."  Ugh!  Well, be sure to join me next week, for "THE MUMMY'S CURSE."  Until then... pleasant nightmares. Vampira blows a kiss, then disappears into the mist.  A U CAR COMMERCIAL abruptly comes on.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: He stares at the TV, then picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampira is walking off stage.  She removes her black wig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, we need some better jokes on this show. A PRODUCTION ASSISTANT carries over a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampira, you got a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this hour? (she takes the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampira!  Hi, this is Ed Wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Wood!  You came to my party.  I directed "Bride Of The Atom"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Yeah.  You. Ed pauses, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was wondering if maybe sometime you'd like to go out, and maybe grab some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like a date?  I thought you were a fag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME?!  No, uh, I'm just a transvestite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that the same thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no!  I like girls.  So how 'bout Friday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you seem like a nice guy, Ed, but you're just not my type. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But keep in touch.  Let me know when your movie opens.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Click.  The phone hangs up.  Poor Ed just stands there, forlorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed shuffles down the street, Mr. Lonely Guy, feeling sorr himself. He glances in a coffee shop, and sees a sweet young woman inside.  Her name is NORMA McCARTY.  She wears a bow in h hair, Mary Jane shoes, and a fuzzy white angora sweater. Ed's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Innocent Norma sits by herself, eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Is that angora? Norma looks up.  Standing over her is Ed, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think angora has a tactile sensuality lacking in all other clothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose.  It's very expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's made from specially-bred rabbits that live in the Himalayas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, an angora wholesaler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I work in pictures.  I'm a director-actor-writer-producer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, c'mon!  Nobody does all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people do.  Orson Welles and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a very attractive girl. Norma blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness, you're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be embarrassed by the truth. (he smoothly sits down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I order some hotcakes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell and Paul drive at night.  They're dressed-up.  S MUSIC plays on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's the surprise for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  Ed was real mysterious. All he'd say was it's a surprise party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that like him! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And isn't that like us -- that we show up anyway. They pull up to a GUARD GATE.  They're at a studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  We're here for the Wood party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've rented Stage 12.  Drive straight back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another rambunctious party in progress.  Crepe p streamers hang down.  Bela approaches Tor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows.  But there's a lotta booze. Suddenly Ed steps into the middle of the room.  He's extr handsome in his tuxedo, and beaming happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me!  Could everyone please quiet down? (the room quiets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, I want to thank you, all my good friends, for being here tonight.  And second, if you're wondering what the big surprise is... well, TONIGHT I'M GETTING MARRIED!! The crowd is stunned. Many people DROP their glasses. Ed proudly pulls out Norma.  She's in a wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody, this is Norma!

dialogues.speaker: ON BELA AND TOR
dialogues.text: They're bewildered.  Bela WHISPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is she??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of her. Ed walks over.  He hugs Bela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bela, I want you to be the best man! Bela smiles -- trying to hide his total confusion.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The wedding is in progress.  The crowd is seated.  A MINI performs the ceremony with Ed and Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Norma, do you promise to love, honor, and cherish...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Everybody is QUIETLY GOSSIPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even know he had a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he taps him on the shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear she's an actress who gave him money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I heard she's his childhood sweetheart from Poughkeepsie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predict it's Dolores in a mask.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: The Minister is speaking to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in sickness and in health, till death do you part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I now pronounce you man and wife. Ed kisses Norma. The crowd doesn't applaud.  They're too baffled by this w event.

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEPTION
dialogues.text: Everyone's drinking and dancing.  Ed proudly introduces N to his buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma, this is Bela -- Bela, this is Norma.  Norma, this is Tor -- Tor, this is Norma.  Norma, this is Paul Paul, this is Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long have you known Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Tuesday. Criswell grabs Ed and pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, are you sure you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It seems a little crazy, but sometimes you just know.  She's perfect for me. Outside, a car HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oop, that's our cue! (to Norma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we gotta go.  GOODBYE,

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY
dialogues.text: Ed and Norma run out the door.  The crowd hurries after t

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Ed and Norma jump into his Nash.  It says "Just Married" festooned with dangling tin cans.  The car screeches away cans RATTLE NOISILY, then slowly fade into the distance..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at a desert roadside motel, the San Bernardino Arms "Vacancy" light flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed excitedly carries Norma over the threshold.  He throws onto the bed, and they start ardently making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I'm just a small-town girl. I've never done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll teach you. He helps her remove her wedding dress.  She is very shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be understanding.  I don't know anything. Ed removes his jacket, then gestures to his shirt.  Norma nervously starts unbuttoning it. Ed bites his lip in anticipation. Norma opens the shirt... and inside, Ed is wearing a bra! Norma is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck is THIS?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I have a little secret to share with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a loud woman's SCREAM. Then the door slams open, and Norma runs hysterically out clutching her dress about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me!  You're perverted! Ed runs out after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, be compassionate.  I'm your husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not!  This marriage was never consummated.  I'm getting an annulment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed drives sadly through the streets, alone.  His car stil "Just Married," and the tin cans RATTLE behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's car pulls up.  Ed stumbles out, yanks off the tin ca and throws them in someone's trash. Ed despondently approaches Bela's.  Inside, a light glows the dogs BARK. Ed is relieved.  Bela's awake.  He BANGS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, let me in!  Bela, it's Eddie. He keeps BANGING.  Finally the door opens -- and Bela sta there, shakily waving a gun!  Bela is doped up, glassy-ey and disturbingly haggard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  Bela, what's with the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you on your honeymoon? Where's Myrna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma.  She changed her mind.  She doesn't wanna marry me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you put down the gun? Bela weakly lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed walks in, in a near-stupor.  Needles and drug parapher are scattered about

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about killing myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what an evening. (he looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I received a letter from the government.  They're cutting off my unemployment.  That's all I've got. Without it, I can't pay the rent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have any savings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm obsolete.  I have nothing to live for.  Tonight, I should die. (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you should come with me. Frail Bela points the gun at Ed.  Ed is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, I don't know if that's such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be wonderful.  We'll be at peace.  In the afterlife, you don't have to worry about finding work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, I'm on your side.  C'mon, give me the gun... (he cautiously steps forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you give me the gun, I'll make you a drink.  What are you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formaldehyde. Ed stares in anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight up or on the rocks? Bela drops the gun.  He starts weeping. Ed walks over and hugs the shaking old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Eddie.  I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  Everything's gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's car pulls up at the South Metropolitan State Hospita It's a grim, unwelcoming edifice. Ed helps weak Bela from the car.  They look at each other Ed gingerly leads Bela in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is clammy and dim.  Ed and Bela reach the desk. NURSE looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness, you gave me the willies. You look like that Dracula guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very somber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Bela Lugosi.  I wish to commit myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been a drug addict for twenty years.  I need help... The nurse nods.  She takes Bela's arm and leads him away. glances at Ed, then steps through a wide door.
