As it swi shut, we see a DOCTOR walk over and shake Bela's hand. Ed stares at the door, dazed by all that's happened.  He down in a chair, exhausted. Ed's eyes slowly close, and he falls asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is still asleep, but now sunlight beats in. Ed stirs and wakes up.  He groggily looks around, and sit across from him is a woman, knitting.  This is KATHY O'HA 26, solid, reflective, with a dry sense of humor.  Ed pee her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sleeping in a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got married last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marriage already ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  My condolences. Ed watches her knit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you making?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booties for my father.  He gets cold in this hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's he been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my thirteenth pair. Ed nods.  He spots the Doctor walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (he runs to the Doctor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor?  I'm with Mr. Lugosi.  How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... there's a lot of junk in his system for such an old man. Apparently, he was addicted to morphine, tried to kick it, and got re-addicted to methadone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are outside Bela's room.  He can be glimpsed inside, strapped to the bed and SCREAMING in pain.  He is going t painful withdrawal and shakes horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed strides into the hospital, wearing different clothes, carrying a box of chocolates.  He waves at the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ed.  Boy, he's got a lot of visitors today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does? Ed is puzzled.  He hurries back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of NEWSPAPER REPORTERS and PHOTOGRAPHERS overflow Bela's room.  Ed is astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?!  Excuse me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decrepit Bela is propped up in his bed, as the mob of rep throw questions at hit and SNAP shots: "Bela, how long ha been a junkie??" "Bela, look this way!" Ed angrily pushes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody out!  This is a hospital! Get out of here. Ed forces them out, then SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a hoarse whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it wonderful?  After all these years, the press is showing an interest again in Bela Lugosi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, they're parasites!  They just want to exploit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Let them!  There is no such thing as bad press.  A man from New York even said he's putting me on the front page!  First celebrity to ever check into rehab. (he smiles feebly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get out of here, I will be healthy.  Strong!  I will be primed for my comeback! Bela starts COUGHING heavily.  Ed stares sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed sits tensely in the lobby, holding vigil.  Kathy O'Har walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  How's your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's better.  Thank you for asking. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good... Kathy reaches in her purse and pulls out two black bootie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I made him some booties to cheer him up. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're black -- to match his cape. She smiles. Ed slowly smiles in response.  But this isn't his normal smile.  It's gentler.  Sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you maybe like to get a coffee..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and the Doctor stand in a doorway, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought Mr. Lugosi was insured though the Screen Actors Guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They say his eligibility ran out years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he doesn't have any money... but I'll give you everything I've got.  I have a few hundred dollars. The Doctor shakes his head grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't even begin to cover it. He's going to have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela lies sleeping in bed, pasty and pale.  NEWSPAPER CLI of his hospital stay are tacked up. Ed anxiously tiptoes in.  He quietly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela, wake up. Bela stirs lethargically.  Ed puts on a fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some good news.  The doctor says you're all better.  You can come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so weak, he's barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I don't feel so great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you look good.  And the tests came back fine. (a poignant pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Ed gingerly helps Bela up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela slowly gets into Ed's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I wanna make another picture. When are we gonna make another picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, Bela... Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is desperately trying to cut a deal with the OLD MANAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I just need it for one afternoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, if I cut a deal for you, I gotta cut one for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is different!  It'll mean so much to me.  All I need is a camera and a tripod.  No lights, no sound. Nothin' fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one roll of film. The old guy gives Ed a tough look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela is dressed in his Sunday finest, standing in front o little house.  He wears a cloak and a wide-brimmed hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so exciting.  Another production! WE WIDEN.  Out on the lawn... is just Ed.  With the camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Eddie, don't we need a sound crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is just the second unit. We'll do the main footage later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  So what is the scene about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (improvising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... you're a very important and respected man.  You're leaving your house... and you're in a hurry to a big social event. Bela nods.  He mulls this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  But what if I'm not in too big a hurry?  What if I take a moment to slow down and savor the beauty of life?  To smell a flower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.  Let's do a take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela goes in the front door.  Ed gets behind the camera, turns it ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, roll camera!  Rolling.  Scene One, Take One! (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... ACTION! There's a moment.  And then Bela slowly steps outside, ca dignified, walking with a cane.  He looks about -- and th something catches his eye.  He leans down and picks a flo Bela smells the flower, then abruptly drops it.  He start crying.  A pause, and then he composes himself.  The old slowly shuffles out of frame. Ed peers emotionally from behind the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, cut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, how was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Bela is pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what about my close up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's Nash convertible pulls up outside a neat little dupl a nice neighborhood.  Ed is dressed up for a date.  He ch his hair nervously in the mirror, revealing an anxious boyishness we've never seen before. Ed carries a bouquet of flowers to the front door.  He ri the bell.  Kathy opens the door.  She looks very pretty i full skirt with a crinolin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, flowers!  I didn't know you were so traditional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just picked them up on the way over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're very nice. (she smiles sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kathy are at a tattered traveling carnival.  Rattl steel rides and flashing lights spin about them.  They st through the crowds eating cotton candy.  Kathy wears one Ed's flowers on her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have you always lived in L.A.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm from back east.  You know, All-American small town... everybody knew everybody, I was a Boy Scout, my dad worked for the post office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you lived in Grovers Corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kathy ride through the old mechanical spook house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find it boring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, 'cause I had my comic books. And I read pulp magazines.  And I listened to the radio dramas... A wooden WITCH jumps out at them.  They ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  I loved those shows!  "Inner Sanctum"... "The Shadow" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Don't forget "Mercury Theatre"... And then every Saturday, I'd go to the little movie theater down the street.  I even started ushering there. A creaky GHOST flies overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna believe the first picture I ever saw.  Your friend's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dracula." Ed freaks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's INCREDIBLE!  That's the first picture I ever saw!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mechanical BATS drop down and flap around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is incredible! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I had to sleep with the lights on for a week after seeing that movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to sleep with the lights on for a month. (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I never missed a Lugosi picture after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few years ago, I actually saw him do "Dracula" live.  I thought he was much scarier in person.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He starts at Kathy in wonder.  He is overcome. Their car SMASHES through the tin exit doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kathy's little car comes to a stop.  He gets very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, I'm about to tell you something I've never told any girl on a first date.  But I think it's important that you know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to wear women's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to wear women's clothes: Panties, brassieres, sweaters, pumps... it's just something I do. And I can't believe I'm telling you, but I really like you, and I don't want it getting in the way down the road. Kathy is amazed.  She contemplates all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean you don't like sex with girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I love sex with girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Kathy slyly grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Ed grins back.  A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is on the telephone.  We SPLIT-SCREEN with Vampira. ED (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampira!  Hi, it's Ed Wood. VAMPIRA (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, I told you, I don't wanna go out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't worry, I moved on.  I was just calling to see if you want to attend the world premiere of my new film, "Bride Of The Monster."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you just make one called "Bride Of The Atom"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same film.  But the distributor wanted a punchier title. C'mon!  It's gonna be a big event -- we're going all out!  Bela, Tor, and Cris are coming.  You'll have fun! Vampira rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of KIDS and TEENAGERS enter a dilapidated second theater.  A banner says "'Bride Of The Monster' World Pre Celebrities In Person!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An antique limousine HEARSE drives down a dingy street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed drives.  Tor, ill Bela, Vampira, and Criswell are cram with him, along with bewildered Kathy. Everyone is dressed in gaudy "scary" outfits.  Tor wears frightening WHITE CONTACT LENSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eyes are killink me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still hoarse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, where are we?  We passed that carwash twenty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predict we're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bela)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You wanna watch the hands?? Bela sheepishly removes his hand from her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he looks around, baffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever been to Downey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is so restless, they're practically rioting. CLAP AND CHANT angrily. A fat patronizing MANAGER steps on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children, if you don't calm down, there won't be the entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was supposed to start an hour ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tempers are flaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eyes are burnink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look!  There's the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  I can't see nothink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse pulls up.  A FRANTIC USHER runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God, you're here!  They're tearing the place apart! The gang awkwardly steps out of the hearse.  Tor gets out blindly walks straight into a lamp post.  WHACK!  He yelp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Bela moves slowly, very feeble.  Vampira smooths out her black dress, then puts her arm around Bela to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!  This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell points Tor in the right direction, and the group stumbles in.  Ed escorts excited Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been to a premiere before. The Usher opens the auditorium doors.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: It's PANDEMONIUM.  People are screaming and shouting.  Ki up and down, on top of the chairs. Bela, Tor, Vaspira, and Criswell are alarmed. The lights dim on and off.  Scratchy SPOOKY MUSIC blasts the sound system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  Go knock 'em dead! Criswell pushes blind Tor towards the stage.  Tor sticks his arms and scarily staggers down the aisle.  Criswell nervously follows.  Vampira escorts Bela. The crowd BOOS.  They pelt our gang with popcorn. Tor GROWLS like a monster.  Kids LAUGH and jeer.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED AND KATHY
dialogues.text: In back, Ed speaks in a frightening manner into a MICROPH ED (amplified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooo!  At the stroke of midnight, the witching hour, the ghouls arise from the dead!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE AISLE
dialogues.text: Tor slips in some butter.  He tumbles and falls. A WOMAN'S VOICE cackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the blind leading the blind! Tor staggers to his feet.  All disoriented, he starts wal the wrong direction and falls over a chair.  People HECKL Criswell quickly helps his up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dis is a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's show biz. Criswell pushes Tor in the right direction.  Some roughne knock down Criswell and snatch his wallet. A MEAN BOY jumps on his chair, ripping the stuffing out o seat.  He throws the fibers in the air, and they float ov Bela and Vampira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're getting ready to burn this place down. A HIGH SCHOOL PUNK runs up and grabs Vampira's breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vampira, how 'bout a little love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off! She impulsively swings her arm and SLAMS the kid.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: The Manager pleads to the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children, please!  Be calm! Somebody throws a bottle and HITS him in the head.  He go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights suddenly go off.  Some girls SCREAM. Ed's panicked.  He grabs Kathy and runs down to his frien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!  We're getting the hell out of here! Ed rounds up Bela, Tor, Criswell, and Vampira. The crowd BOOS louder.  Blind Tor is totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're escaping! The group runs up the aisle and leaves.  As the doors clo "Bride Of The Monster" starts unspooling on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang frantically runs out, scared for their lives. They look over.  Some JUVENILE DELINQUENTS are stripping hearse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die. The theater doors CRASH open.  The angry mob pours out. Ed spins wildly around... and sees a cab approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Kathy runs frenziedly into the street and throws herself cab.  It screeches to a halt. Everybody sprints over and jumps in.  The cab ROARS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them are breathing heavily.  They watch in the rea window as they drive away from the rampage. A nervous silence.  Until Bela speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that was a premiere. All of them LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela and Ed stroll down the street, in high spirits.  Bel smokes a big fat cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night was quite a romp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that kid grab Vampira's tits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envied him. (he chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I envied you too, having a girlfriend that would jump in front of a car like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's really somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know none of my wives would've. Ed laughs.  Bela puffs his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I want to thank you.  These last few days have been a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish you coulda seen the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  I know it by heart... Bela stops walking.  And in a BOOMING, THEATRICAL VOICE, suddenly launches into his impassioned, climactic speech "Bride Of The Monster."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Home.  I have no home.  Hunted... despised... living like an animal -- the jungle is my home!  But I will show the world that I can be its master.  I shall perfect my own race of people... a race of atomic supermen that will conquer the world!" Ed is touched. A few people around them APPLAUD. Bela's face lights up, proud.  An awed MIDWESTERN TOURIST him a pen and paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lugosi, could I have your autograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, that was incredible.  You're just as good an actor as you always were. Bela puffs out his chest majestically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seventy-four, but I don't know it.  If the brain is young, then the spirit is still vigorous... like a young man. Bela turns and smiles wanly at Ed. Ed smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kathy stand in his kitchen, making dinner.  She st her finger in a pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, this spaghetti sauce is delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  It's actually the only thing I know how to make. (he motions)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can you grab that strainer? She holds a strainer.  Ed pours the spaghetti over it. Suddenly the PHONE rings. Ed groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! Always at the wrong time. (he ANSWERS the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? He listens. And then, he gets a very somber expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Ed HANGS UP the phone.  He looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bela died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bela's funeral. Ed sits crying in the front row, with Kathy at his side. All Bela's friends are there.  They're very subdued.

dialogues.speaker: THE CASKET
dialogues.text: Bela lies inside, made up in his full Dracula outfit.  Hi is died black, and he wears the famous cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a grassy hill, Bela is laid to rest.  The small crowd mourners stands silhouetted against the dark gray clouds. The coffin is lowered into the ground.  Ed stands at the silently watching.

dialogues.speaker: AT A DISTANCE
dialogues.text: A few TABLOID PHOTOGRAPHERS snap pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose crazy idea was it to bury him in the cape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it was in the will.  It was how he wanted to be remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is alone in a darkened screening room, depressed. Playing on the SCREEN is the last footage of Bela: Bela stumbles around in front of his house and smells the flow Ed drinks out of a flask. The film runs out.  A VOICE comes over a loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to run it again? Ed silently nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's apartment has gone to hell.  Ed is in a robe, unshav clutching a bottle of whiskey.  Newspapers are everywhere Bela's and Ed's dogs eat out of the trash. Kathy tries to straighten things up.  Ed stares listlessl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd seen him in a coffin so many times, I expected him to jump out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, you've got to snap out of this. Bela's dead -- you're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might as well be.  I made shitty movies that nobody wanted to see. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I blew it.  All he wanted was a comeback... that last glory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you tried --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a fuckin' HACK!  I let people recut the movies, cast their relatives... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let Bela down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new Studebaker pulls up.  A bumper sticker says "JESUS A man in a plain brown suit steps out.  This is J. EDWARD REYNOLDS, 50, Ed's santironious southern Christian landlo Reynolds assertively bangs on Ed's front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hruphh...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood, this is Mr. Reynolds, your landlord.  Could you please open up? The door opens a crack.  Bleary Ed peers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood, you have bounced your third and final rent check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sloppily lies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real sorry.  My stockbroker must have transferred the wrong account... C'mon in, I'll write you another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed motions Reynolds in.  Reynolds peers unsurely at the t inside.  Then he notices a framed one-sheet for "BRIDE OF MONSTER."  Reynolds admires it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, so you're in the picture business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rummaging for a check)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested in the picture business.  My associates and I wish to produce a series of uplifting religious films, on the Apostles. But unfortunately, we don't have enough money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raising money is tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Our church has the money for one film.  We just don't have it for all twelve...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: His eyes suddenly pop. The color comes back to his fact.  A plan is quickly boil over inside Ed's head.  He starts feverishly pacing aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- you know what you do?  You produce a film in a commercially proven genre.  And after it's a hit, you take the profits from that, and make the twelve Apostles' movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely!  You see this script..? Ed randomly grabs a script off the messy floor, then glan down, to see which one he picked up.  It says "Graverobbe From Outer Space."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Graverobbers From Outer Space"! It's money in the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graverobbers from what??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outer space!  It's science- fiction.  Very big with the kids! If you make this picture, you'll have enough money to finance a HUNDRED religious films! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pay my back rent from the profits. Reynolds scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... this is all a lot to absorb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a guaranteed blockbuster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I understand that this science friction is popular -- but don't the big hits always have big stars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a frenzy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well we've GOT a big star! Bela Lugosi!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mystified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lugosi                          Didn't be pass on? Ed grins maniacally.  He grabs a SMALL REEL of 35mm film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I've got the last footage he ever shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, it doesn't look like very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's plenty!  It's the acorn that will grow a great oak.  I'll just find a double to finish his scenes, and we'll release it as "Bela Lugosi's Final Film" A beat.  Reynolds stares, intrigued...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is cleaned-up.  Ed shouts excitedly into the ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunny!  We're making another film! Yeah -- I got the Baptist Church of Beverly Hills to put up the cash! Paul sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, I got the Lugosi lookalikes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!  Bring 'em in!  Bunny, I gotta run. Ed hangs up. Paul leads in THREE.  They look nothing like Bela.  One i a HOMELESS BUM, one is a SHORT FAT MAN, and one is CHINES Ed inspects them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too tall... too short... (he glances at the Chinese guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this guy doesn't work at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was thinkin' like, when Bela played "Fu Manchu."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Karloff. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, you gotta try harder.  I don't want this film to be haif-assed. This time, we go for the quality. Paul turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, keep Sunday free. The producers want all of us to get baptized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy reads a newspaper while knitting an angora sweater. is typing deliriously fast -- in one of his artistic feve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when you rewrite a script, it just gets better and better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want your buttons on the left or the right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The left.  It's more natural. (he squints at his script)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've got a scene where the aliens have the ultimate bomb.  What would that be made of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, atomic energy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They're beyond that!  They're smarter than the humans.  What's more advanced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dynamite --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, BIGGER!  What's the biggest energy??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  BINGO!  Solar energy!  Oh that's gonna seem so scientific. (he resumes TYPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This movie's gonna be the ultimate Ed Wood film.  No compromises. Kathy suddenly jumps up, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Look at this! She runs over and shows Ed the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: A small headline says "VAMPIRA REVEALED TO BE RED."  Unde is the story: "Channel 7 has fired popular horror hostess Vampira, after learning of her suspected communist leanin

dialogues.speaker: ON ED AND KATHY
dialogues.text: They're astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor girl's out of a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (he looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should give her a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Kathy sit with a shaken-up Vampira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrible.  People won't even return my calls.  It's like I don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what that's like. (he pulls out his SCRIPT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I brought a copy of the script.  You would play the "Ghoul's Wife."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she grimaces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghoul's Wife?!  God, I can't believe I'm doing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should feel lucky.  Ed's the only guy in town who doesn't pass judgment on people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, if I did, I wouldn't have any friends. Vampira smiles uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... would it be possible to make the "Ghoul's Wife" a little less prominent, so people won't really notice me in the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wanna be noticed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Hey, how 'bout this -- what if I don't have any lines?  I'll do the part mute! Kathy suddenly sees someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's Dr. Tom. (she SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dr. Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Dr. Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My chiropractor! DR. TOM MASON, a tall, slender 35-year-old chiropractor, strides over.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, how are you?!  You're looking in alignment today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my neck's a little funny. Dr. Mason grabs Kathy's neck and CRACKS it loudly.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: Ed stares at the Doctor in astonishment.  Ed is riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.  Don't move! Ed excitedly jumps up, takes his NAPXIN, and covers the Doctor's face from the nose down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's uncanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's uncanny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Services are in progress.  J. Edward Reynolds leads a CHO singing an emotional SPIRITUAL. Ed, Tor, Criswell, Paul, Conrad, Vampira, Kathy, Bunny, a Tom Mason sit in back.  They're all wearing white robes a arguing about the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He look nutink like Bela!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kinds got his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, cover up his face. Kathy lifts Dr. Mason's robe over his bewildered face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  Now I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goofily imitating Bela)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I want to suck your blood!" Everybody CRACKS up.  Ed waves his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHHH!  We want these Baptists to like us. Like bad kids, they quiet down.  Ingenuous Southern REVER LYN LEMON speaks up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brothers and Sisters, we've reached a special part of the service.  The baptism of our new members! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the congregation will oblige, we'd like to adjourn and reconvene at Emma DuBois's back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The straight-laced, devout CONGREGATION is gathered aroun large SWIMMING POOL.  Reverend Lemon, Reynolds, and our m stand in the shallow end, in their white robes. Criswell whispers to Vampira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't we do this in the church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because "Brother TorГ® couldn't fit in the sacred tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Do you accept the Lord Jesus Christ as your savior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Reynolds DUNKS Ed in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Do you reject Satan and all his works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding a smirk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Reynolds DUNKS Bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Do you repent for all your sins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Tor winks slyly at Criswell. Reynolds DUNKS Tor.  But Tor slips from Reynolds' grasp a sinks to the bottom of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I dropped him -- Tor lies on the bottom, staring lifeinsly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mischievous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's coming up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord no!  The man's drowning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  HELP!!! The whole Congregation starts JUMPING IN.  Men and women their Sunday finest leap into the pool and start tugging Tor.  But nobody can budge the big whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Jesus, please forgive us!

dialogues.speaker: ON TOR
dialogues.text: He suddenly rises, Poseidon-like, from the pool. Tor spits out water, then lets out a hearty BELLY LAVGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tor make good joke! The Baptists aren't amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus drives along.  Every PASSENGER stares at something front -- Vampira, in her slinky black outfit.  She reads "Grave Robbers From Outer Space" script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus stops in a scary, run-down neighborhood.  Vampira off and warily looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be the right address... She nervously walks down a dingy alley.  Vampira gets to unmarked grimy door, gulps, then slowly opens it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And inside is the "Grave Robbers From Outer Space" famous CEMETERY SET!  The film is in production!  Packed into a stinking little studio are a few scrawny twigs, branches, flimsy cardboard tombstones set against a black drop. Tot struts about gregariously, in his "Inspector Clay" su He chats up the CREW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so happy!  Finally I am star wit dialogue!  I memorized every wordt. Eddie will be so proud! The Baptists chase Ed around.  They wave the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we start shooting, Mr. Wood, we have a few questions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The script refers on numerous occasions to graverobbing.  Now we find the concept of digging up consecrated ground highly offensive. It's blasphemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!  It's the premise of the movie.  It's even the title, for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, about that title, it strikes us as very inflammatory.  Why don't we change it to "Plan Nine From Outer Space"?                                       Ed shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: CEMETERY SET
dialogues.text: They're filming the COPS arriving at the pitch-black ceme There's a prop police car, and an assistant blows fog in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, ACTION! Tor steps onto the set            TOR (as Inspector Clay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Medicul eksaminer been aroundt yet?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Just left.  The morgue wagon oughta be along most any time."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You get statement frumk vitnesses?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yeah, but they're pretty scared."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Findink mess like dis oughta make anyone frightened.  Have one of da boyz take dem back to town.  You       take jarge."

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CREW
dialogues.text: Everybody grices, trying to understand Tor.  The SCRIPT G shakes her head. The Baptists angrily pull Ed aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you give him all the lines for??  He's unintelligible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Lugosi is dead and Vampira won't talk.   Ihad to give somebody the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an answer.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: As Inspector Clay, Tor wanders around the "cemtery," wavi his flashlight and nervously fingering his gun. Ed grins at the Baptists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, no talking.  Isn't he good? (he grabs his MEGAPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: CUE DR. TOM
dialogues.text: DR. TOM (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: KEEP YOUR FACE COVERED
dialogues.text: The door of a large paper-mache crypt creeps open.  Dr. T uncertainly steps out, impersonating Bela.  He holds the over his face and stalks Tor. Ed is pleased as punch.  He whispers to the Baptists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it wonderful?  Bela lives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't this strike you as a bit morbid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he would've loved it!  Bela's returned from the grave -- like Dracula. (he grabs the MEGAPHONE)

dialogues.speaker: CUE VAMPIRA
dialogues.text: Vampira steps out, walking in a trance.  Tor is now corne He fruitlessly FIRES his gun, but bullets can't stop zomb Vampira and Dr. Tom kill him.  Tor screams.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Paul and Conrad are scared cops exploring the cemetery. CONRAD (as a cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let's go down and find out whose grave it is." PAUL MARCO (as a cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Why do I always get hooked up with these spook details?  Monsters! Graves!  Bodies!"

dialogues.speaker: CUE THE FLYING SAUCER, RAY
dialogues.text: Off-stage, a grip on a ladder pans a 10K SEARCHLIGHT. The LIGHT crosses the actors.  They look up in horror, th clumsily fall down.  A rickety fake tombstone tips over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And PERFECT.  CUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Perfect"?  Mr. Wood, do you know anything about the art of film production?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cardboard headstone tipped over. This graveyard is obviously phony!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People won't notice.  Filmmaking isn't about picky details -- it's about the big picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you wanna talk about the "big picture"?!  How 'bout that the policemen arrive in the daylight, but now it's suddenly night??? Ed suddenly flips out.  He's livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU DON'T KNOW ANYTHING!  Haven't you ever heard of "suspension of disbelief"?! A STRAPPING YOUNG MAN walks up.  He smiles at the Baptist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend, I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our choir director.  He's gonna play the young hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you IN5ANE?  I'm the director! I make the casting decisions around here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was a group effort.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: Ed spastically storms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed bursts in.  He paces about, hysterically traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're driving me crazy!  These Baptists are stupid, stupid, STUPID! Ed glances at a clothing rack -- and sees an ANGORA SWEAT Ed is taken aback.  He slowly removes it from the hanger rubs it against his face.  His breathing slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.  I need to calm... Take deep breaths... (he rubs the angora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh, it's so smooth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dressing room door flies open.  Ed slowly struts out, the sweater, pantsuit, and pumps.  He is calmed and at ease. The stage quiets.  People are staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone!  Let's set up for Scene 112!  Move the crypt stage left and get ready with Tor's make-up effect. The crew resumes working.  But the Baptists charge up, ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wood?  What do you think you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm directing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like THAT, you're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove that get-up immediately.  You shame our Lord. Ed throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  I give up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed frantically marches out of the building.  He's still i ladies' outfit.  Ed sees a cab and WHISTLES loudly. The cab pulls over.  Ed jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to the nearest bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MUSSO & FRANKS - DAY The place is quiet, mid-morning.  Frazzled Ed enters and at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imperial whiskey, straight up. The bartender nonchalantly pours a shot.  Ed takes the dr He quietly sips his booze and reflects upon his day. Ed glances around. And then, suddenly -- his eyes widen. Sitting at a table is ORSON WELLES!  The portly, world-fa filmmaker sits alone, eating lunch with one hand and draw STORYBOARDS with the other. Ed is thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  It's Orson Welles... Ed nervously stands.  He starts to step forward -- when h catches his own reflection in a mirror.  He's still in dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Ed rolls his eyes.  He runs his hand through his hair, th slowly approaches Orson Welles.  Ed is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he casually looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh, I'm a young filmmaker, and a really big fan... and I just wanted to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he extends his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.  I'm Orson Welles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Um, I'm Ed Wood! (he smiles anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you working on now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, the financing just fell through for the third time on "Don Quixote." So I'm trying to finish a promo for something else.  But I can't find the soundtrack -- (he shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I left it in Malta. Ed is astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.  These sound like my problems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the damn money men.  You never know who's a windbag, and who's got the goods.  And then they all think they're a director...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that the truth!  I've even bad producers recut my movies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh, I hate when that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a roll)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they always want to cast their buddies -- it doesn't even matter if they're right for the part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.  I'm supposed to do a thriller at Universal, and they want Charlton Heston to play a Mexican! Ed shakes his head.  He's discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Welles, is it all worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is when it works. (solemn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the one film of mine I can stand to watch?  "Kane."  The studio hated it... but they didn't get to touch a frame. (he smiles warmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, visions are worth fighting for. Why spend your life making someone else's dreams?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He has seen God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed bursts onto the stage, a changed man.  Re-energized, h confidently grabs the Baptists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Reynolds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gonna finish this film just the way I want it!  Because you can't compromise an artist's vision!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-but it's our money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna make a bundle.  This movie's gonna be famous!  But only if you SHUT UP, and let me do it my way! Reynolds and Rev. Lemon are speechiess.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He beams, turns and SHOUTS TRIUMPHANTLY into the soundsta

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE CEMETERY SET
dialogues.text: Tor plays a zombie rising from the dead.  He wears the sc white contact lenses.  Tor's so big, he has trouble lifti himself from the grave.

dialogues.speaker: EDITING ROOM
dialogues.text: Ed and his stock footage buddy watch a moviola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I want that tank!  And I want that bomb!

dialogues.speaker: SOUNDSTAGE
dialogues.text: Harry paints Bunny's face GREEN, like a Martian.  Ed yell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!  The aliens should look like people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' ya, aliens are always green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in my movie, they're not!

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE SPACESHIP SET
dialogues.text: Bunny's make-up is now normal.  He wears an alien suit.  A HAMMY ALIEN enters and salutes with a bizarre crossing gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "What plan will we follow?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Plan Nine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Plan Nine..." (he consults his papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ah yes.  Plan Nine deals with the resurrection of the dead."

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Tor staggers up to Paul Marco and CLOBBERS him.

dialogues.speaker: OFF-STAGE
dialogues.text: Ed smiles at the Baptists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you guys were right.  "Plan Nine" is a good title.

dialogues.speaker: MINIATURE CITY SET
dialogues.text: Ed shoots the famous flying saucers.  Paul holds a paper and Conrad lights it on fire. The "saucer" soars on fishing line over a little miniatur town.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE BEDROOM SET
dialogues.text: Dr. Tom glides in, his cape over his face.  A woman SCREA

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT SET
dialogues.text: Ed stands in front of a masonite board and two chairs.  A actor playing the AIRPLANE PILOT walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the cockpit set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're standing in it. (he yells off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, bring in the shower curtain! A shower curtain gets lowered into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car zooms by.  Kathy drives, as Ed shoots handheld out back window.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE SPACESHIP SET
dialogues.text: Th Hammy Alien argues with the humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So what if we develop this solarnite bomb?  We'd be even a stronger nation."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Stronger?  You see!  You see!!  Your stupid minds!  Stupid!  STUPID!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That's all I'm taking from you." He WHACKS the alien.  A brawl breaks out.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE WITH CRISWELL
dialogues.text: Criswell lectures behind a desk, with mysterious lighting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Perhaps on your way home, someone will pass you in the dark, and you will never know it.  For they will be from outer space."

dialogues.speaker: SCENE IN THE CEMETERY SET
dialogues.text: The famous shot: Tor and Vampira walk in a trance through foggy cemetery. Off-stage, Ed stands with the crew.  He shouts gleefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More fog!  More fog!! (he beams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CUT!  PRINT IT!  IT'S A WRAP! END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pouring rain.  Standing in the drench is Ed.  He's w a tux, and fighting with his open convertible top.  The Rambler is filled with water. Kathy stands under an awning.  She wears a pretty gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get it to go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, you're gonna miss your own premiere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he gives up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!  Let's just go. Ed impulsively opens the car door.  Water pours out.  Kat scurries out and jumps in the wet car with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is gushing down.  The marquee proclaims "WORLD

dialogues.speaker: PREMIERE
dialogues.text: People hurry in.  Ed and Kathy roar up in the open conver totally soaked.  He jumps out, opens her door, and they r inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theater is packed.  All the gang, and their friends a families, are gathered. Criswell stands on-stage, speaking into a mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are about to see en extraordinary motion picture.  But before it begins, I think we ought to give a hand to the man without whom we wouldn't be here tonight... Eddie, take a bow! The crowd ERUPTS in applause.  Everybody goes crazy -- ev Baptists.  People YELL "Speech! Speech!" Ed smiles proudly.  Kathy kisses him.  Ed runs down front Criswell, then takes the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a million.  I just wanna say... this film is for Bela. The lights dim.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: The title "PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE" is projected onto the screen.  As random IMAGES from the film play out, we drif the happy faces of our friends watching. Paul and Conrad stare, enthralled. Tor laughs as he sees himself. Vampira giggles.  Bunny nudges her playfully. Criswell mouths his own lines.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Bela appears, in his little suit.  In the last footage he shot, he shuffles around in front of his house, then tend smells the flower.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: He watches, entranced.  Then he smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the one.  I know I'll be remembered for this film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOISTEROUS crowd is in high spirits.  People congratu Ed and pat him on the back.  "It was great!"  "It's your one yet!"  "Bela would've loved it!" Ed drifts through the crowd, basking in the glory.  It's wonderful dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain comes down in sheets.  The doors burst open, and and Kathy run out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, I'm so happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now.  Let's drive to Vegas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's pouring.  And the car top is stuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he gives his killer grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  It's only a five-hour drive. And it'll probably clear up, once we hit the desert.  Heck, it'll probably clear up once we drive around the corner.  I promise. Kathy stares in disbelief.  Then she smiles.  They kiss. Ed and Kathy jump into the open convertible.  The engine starts, and they drive away, disappearing into the pourin rain. A moment. And then, we move up, up, into the black clouds.  Lightni CRACKS across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly PULL OUT from the sky, move through a window... we're back inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criswell is sitting inside his coffin.  He stares at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend, you have just seen the story of Edward D. Wood, Junior. Stranger than fact... and yet every incident based on sworn testimony. (his eyes gleam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man.  A life.  Can you prove it didn't happen? A beat, to ponder this.  And then Criswell slowly lies ba his coffin, and the lid mysteriously closes over him.
